intro: Velleia rosea var. erecta, commonly known as the upright velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped, velvety leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
